<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 124, 87]]<|/det|>
## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 102, 675, 528]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space, \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space, \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space, \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) elementary charge, \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant, \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass constant, \(u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron, \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton, \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant, \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant, \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant, \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant, \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall, \(g = 9.81\mathrm{m s}^{- 2}\)

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 167, 88]]<|/det|>

alternating current/voltage,

radioactive decay,

decay constant,  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 106, 555, 141]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 160, 521, 175]]<|/det|>
\[W = p\Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 190, 531, 220]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 230, 515, 246]]<|/det|>
\[p = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 258, 570, 290]]<|/det|>
\[p = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V} < c^2 >\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 297, 531, 313]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 330, 600, 365]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_{0}\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(x_{0}^{2} - x^{2})}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 377, 531, 410]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 430, 620, 448]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_{1} + 1 / C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 467, 590, 485]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_{1} + C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 500, 522, 521]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 537, 590, 555]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 572, 620, 590]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 607, 555, 624]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 641, 575, 659]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 675, 530, 707]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[454, 73, 543, 88]]<|/det|>
## Section A  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[299, 103, 699, 120]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the spaces provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 149, 96, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 149, 146, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 149, 430, 167]]<|/det|>
State Newton's law of gravitation.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 272, 146, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 272, 800, 289]]<|/det|>
A satellite of mass \(m\) is in a circular orbit of radius \(r\) about a planet of mass \(M\).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 289, 873, 321]]<|/det|>
For this planet, the product \(GM\) is \(4.00 \times 10^{14} \text{N} \text{m}^2 \text{kg}^{- 1}\), where \(G\) is the gravitational constant.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 320, 586, 337]]<|/det|>
The planet may be assumed to be isolated in space.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 350, 180, 369]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 350, 873, 384]]<|/det|>
By considering the gravitational force on the satellite and the centripetal force, show that the kinetic energy \(E_{\text{K}}\) of the satellite is given by the expression  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 390, 551, 420]]<|/det|>
\[E_{\mathrm{K}} = \frac{GMm}{2r}.\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 581, 876, 600]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 612, 181, 630]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 612, 873, 645]]<|/det|>
The satellite has mass \(620 \text{kg}\) and is initially in a circular orbit of radius \(7.34 \times 10^6 \text{m}\), as illustrated in Fig. 1.1.  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 655, 712, 902]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 917, 588, 934]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 875, 107]]<|/det|>
